metadata.Title: CVE-2019-5849 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Out of bounds read in Skia in Google Chrome prior to 75.0.3770.80 allowed a remote attacker to obtain potentially sensitive information from process memory via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5849` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 76.0.3809.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 76.0.3809.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 76.0.3809.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 76.0.3809.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 76.0.3809.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

firefox - 69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
firefox-geckodriver - 69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
firefox-mozsymbols - 69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '76.0.3809.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.4').
